name: Roo.Resizable
desc:
Applies drag handles to an element to make it resizable. The drag handles are inserted into the element and positioned absolute. Some elements, such as a textarea or image, don't support this. To overcome that, you can wrap the textarea in a div and set "resizeChild" to true (or to the id of the element), or set wrap:true in your config and the element will be wrapped for you automatically.

Here is the list of valid resize handles:

Value   Description
------  -------------------
 'n'     north
 's'     south
 'e'     east
 'w'     west
 'nw'    northwest
 'sw'    southwest
 'se'    southeast
 'ne'    northeast
 'hd'    horizontal drag
 'all'   all

Here's an example showing the creation of a typical Resizable:


var resizer = new Roo.Resizable("element-id", {
    handles: 'all',
    minWidth: 200,
    minHeight: 100,
    maxWidth: 500,
    maxHeight: 400,
    pinned: true
});
resizer.on("resize", myHandler);

To hide a particular handle, set its display to none in CSS, or through script:
resizer.east.setDisplayed(false);

config.name: easing
config.desc: Animation easing if animate = true (defaults to 'easingOutStrong')

config.name: listeners
maxWidth
config.desc: The maximum width for the element (defaults to 10000)

config.name: minWidth
config.desc: The minimum width for the element (defaults to 5)

config.name: dynamic
config.desc: True to resize the element while dragging instead of using a proxy (defaults to false)

config.name: pinned
config.desc:
True to ensure that the resize handles are always visible, false to display them only when the
user mouses over the resizable borders. This is only applied at config time. (defaults to false)

config.name: enabled
config.desc: False to disable resizing (defaults to true)

config.name: handles
config.desc: String consisting of the resize handles to display (defaults to undefined)

config.name: preserveRatio
config.desc: True to preserve the original ratio between height and width during resize (defaults to false)

config.name: minHeight
config.desc: The minimum height for the element (defaults to 5)

config.name: maxHeight
config.desc: The maximum height for the element (defaults to 10000)

config.name: widthIncrement
config.desc: The increment to snap the width resize in pixels (dynamic must be true, defaults to 0)

config.name: resizeChild
config.desc: True to resize the first child, or id/element to resize (defaults to false)

config.name: width
config.desc: The width of the element in pixels (defaults to null)

config.name: transparent
config.desc: True for transparent handles. This is only applied at config time. (defaults to false)

config.name: minX
config.desc: The minimum allowed page X for the element (only used for west resizing, defaults to 0)

config.name: constrainTo
config.desc: Constrain the resize to a particular element

config.name: disableTrackOver
config.desc: True to disable mouse tracking. This is only applied at config time. (defaults to false)

config.name: minY
config.desc: The minimum allowed page Y for the element (only used for north resizing, defaults to 0)

config.name: adjustments
config.desc: String "auto" or an array [width, height] with values to be added to the resize operation's new size (defaults to [0, 0])

config.name: wrap
config.desc: True to wrap an element with a div if needed (required for textareas and images, defaults to false)

config.name: height
config.desc: The height of the element in pixels (defaults to null)

config.name: duration
config.desc: Animation duration if animate = true (defaults to .35)

config.name: animate
config.desc: True to animate the resize (not compatible with dynamic sizing, defaults to false)

config.name: multiDirectional
config.desc: Deprecated. The old style of adding multi-direction resize handles, deprecated in favor of the handles config option (defaults to false)

config.name: heightIncrement
config.desc: The increment to snap the height resize in pixels (dynamic must be true, defaults to 0)

config.name: draggable
config.desc: Convenience to initialize drag drop (defaults to false)

config.name: resizeRegion
config.desc: Constrain the resize to a particular region

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this resizable. If the element was wrapped and
removeEl is not true then the element remains.

params.name: removeEl
params.desc: (optional) true to remove the element from the DOM
